headline.print_headline: Nebraska Ebola Patient Showing More Progress - Hospital
headline.main: Nebraska Ebola Patient Showing More Progress - Hospital

docs.snippet: A U.S. doctor infected with the Ebola virus in West Africa has continued to show progress at the Nebraska Medical Centre where he was taken last week, the hospital said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. doctor infected with the Ebola virus in West Africa has continued to show progress at the Nebraska Medical Centre where he was taken last week, the hospital said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Economic Growth Forecasts Cut for Ebola-Hit West African Nations
headline.main: Economic Growth Forecasts Cut for Ebola-Hit West African Nations

docs.snippet: Sierra Leone has cut its 2014 economic growth forecast to 7 or 8 percent as an Ebola outbreak cripples business in the iron ore-exporting West African country, the government said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sierra Leone has cut its 2014 economic growth forecast to 7 or 8 percent as an Ebola outbreak cripples business in the iron ore-exporting West African country, the government said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Goodell No Stranger to Controversies During Tenure
headline.main: Goodell No Stranger to Controversies During Tenure

docs.snippet: The Ray Rice story is not the first controversy Roger Goodell has faced during his eight-year tenure as NFL commissioner. Here's a look at some of them:...

headline.print_headline: Former Connecticut Governor Secretly Paid to Advise Congressional Campaign, Staff Testify
headline.main: Former Connecticut Governor Secretly Paid to Advise Congressional Campaign, Staff Testify

docs.snippet: Two campaign managers for a 2012 congressional candidate testified on Wednesday that former Connecticut Governor John Rowland, on trial for campaign violations, worked as a top-level adviser while being paid through a phony contract with the candi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Two campaign managers for a 2012 congressional candidate testified on Wednesday that former Connecticut Governor John Rowland, on trial for campaign violations, worked as a top-level adviser while being paid through a phony contract with the candidate's husband's business.

headline.print_headline: Texas Executes Man, 45, for Shooting Spree That Left Two Dead
headline.main: Texas Executes Man, 45, for Shooting Spree That Left Two Dead

docs.snippet: Texas executed a 45-year-old man on Wednesday for killing two people and wounding two others during a shooting spree sparked by a breakup with his girlfriend....
docs.lead_paragraph: Texas executed a 45-year-old man on Wednesday for killing two people and wounding two others during a shooting spree sparked by a breakup with his girlfriend.

headline.print_headline: Keeneland Yearling Sales Top $100 Million Mark
headline.main: Keeneland Yearling Sales Top $100 Million Mark

docs.snippet: Keeneland's September Yearling Sale topped the $100 million mark with celebrity chef Bobby Flay breeding one of two fillies that were purchased for at least $1.1 million each....
docs.lead_paragraph: Keeneland's September Yearling Sale topped the $100 million mark with celebrity chef Bobby Flay breeding one of two fillies that were purchased for at least $1.1 million each.

headline.print_headline: Chile Seeks Foreign Help in Subway Bombing Case
headline.main: Chile Seeks Foreign Help in Subway Bombing Case

docs.snippet: Chile sought help from foreign security agencies in identifying those responsible for an explosion that injured 14 people at a subway station in the capital, while bomb scares and small blasts kept the country on edge Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chile sought help from foreign security agencies in identifying those responsible for an explosion that injured 14 people at a subway station in the capital, while bomb scares and small blasts kept the country on edge Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Potter, Shirley Lead in Women's Mid-Am Semifinals
headline.main: Potter, Shirley Lead in Women's Mid-Am Semifinals

docs.snippet: Defending champion Julia Potter and 2013 runner-up Margaret Shirley led their semifinal matches Wednesday in the U.S. Women's Mid-Amateur when play was suspended because of rain....
docs.lead_paragraph: Defending champion Julia Potter and 2013 runner-up Margaret Shirley led their semifinal matches Wednesday in the U.S. Women's Mid-Amateur when play was suspended because of rain.

headline.main: T-Mobile's Latest Freebies Revolve Around Wi-Fi

docs.snippet: Handing out free services, T-Mobile has gained millions of customers. Now it is adding Wi-Fi-related technology to the mix....
docs.abstract: Handing out free services, T-Mobile has gained millions of customers. Now it is adding Wi-Fi-related technology to the mix.
